title: List of natural horror films
html:

Natural horror is a subgenre of horror films that features natural forces,[1] typically in the form of animals or plants, that pose a threat to human characters.

Though killer animals in film have existed since the release of The Lost World in 1925,[2] two of the first motion pictures to garner mainstream success with a "nature run amok" premise were The Birds, directed by Alfred Hitchcock and released in 1963; and Jaws, directed by Steven Spielberg and released in 1975. Following Jaws, numerous horror films of a similar narrative were produced, including Grizzly (1976), Piranha (1978), and Alligator (1980).[3]

Arthropods[edit]

See also the section on insects.

Arachnids[edit]

  • Kingdom of the Spiders (1977; tarantulas)[1]
  • Arachnophobia (1990; spiders)[4]
  • Ticks (1993; giant ticks)[5]
  • Eight Legged Freaks (2002; giant spiders)[6]
  • Big Ass Spider! (2013; giant spider)[7]
  • Lavalantula (2015; giant lava-breathing tarantulas)[8]

Crustaceans[edit]

  • The Bay (2012; isopods)[9]

Birds[edit]

  • The Birds (1963; flocks of vicious gulls, crows, sparrows and other birds)[3]
    • The Birds II: Land's End (1994)[10]
  • Beaks: The Movie (1987)[1]
  • KAW (2007; ravens)[11]
  • Birdemic: Shock and Terror (2010; mutated birds)[12]
    • Birdemic 2: The Resurrection (2013; mutated birds)[13]

Fish[edit]

Piranhas[edit]

  • Piranha (1978; genetically enhanced piranhas)[14]
    • Piranha II: The Spawning (1982; mutant piranhas)[15]
    • Piranha 3D (2010; prehistoric piranhas)[16]
    • Piranha 3DD (2012; prehistoric piranhas)[17]
  • Piranha (1995; killer piranhas)[18]

Sharks[edit]

  • Jaws (1975; a large great white shark)[19][20]
    • Jaws 2 (1978; a great white shark)[21]
    • Jaws 3 (1983; a great white shark)[22]
  • Great White (1981 a.k.a. L'ultimo squalo; a great white shark)[23]
  • Deep Blood (1989 a.k.a. Sangue negli abissi; a great white shark)[24][25]
  • Deep Blue Sea (1999; large genetically engineered shortfin mako sharks)[26]
  • Red Water (2003; a bull shark)[27]
  • Open Water (2003, Caribbean reef sharks)[28]
  • The Reef (2010; a great white shark)[29]
  • Shark Night (2011; various species of sharks)[30]
  • Bait (2012; two great white sharks)[31]
  • Sharknado (2013; swarms of various species of sharks emerging out tornadoes).[32]
  • 47 Meters Down: Uncaged (2019; cave-dwelling great white sharks)[33]
  • Great White (2021; two great white sharks)[34]
  • The Requin (2022; a great white shark)[35]

Insects[edit]

Ants[edit]

  • The Naked Jungle (1954; army ants)[1]
  • Them! (1954; giant mutated ants)[36]
  • Phase IV (1974; super-intelligent ants of various species)[1]
  • Empire of the Ants (1977; large mutated ants)[37]
  • It Happened at Lakewood Manor (1977)[38]

Honey bees[edit]

  • The Deadly Bees (1966)[39]
  • Killer Bees (1974)[40]
  • The Savage Bees (1976)[41]
  • The Swarm (1978)[3]
  • The Bees (1978)[42]
  • Deadly Invasion: The Killer Bee Nightmare (1995)[43]

Cockroaches[edit]

  • Creepshow (1982, killer cockroaches)[44]
  • Mimic (1997, evolved human-sized genetically engineered cockroaches)[45]

Locusts[edit]

  • Locusts: The 8th Plague (2005)[46]

Wasps[edit]

  • Stung (2015; large mutated wasps)[47]

Mammals[edit]

Bats[edit]

  • The Devil Bat (1940; mutant bats)[48]
  • Nightwing (1979; vampire bats)[3]
  • Bats (1999; genetically altered bats)[49]

Bears[edit]

  • Grizzly (1976; a grizzly bear)[3]
  • Prophecy (1979; a mutant bear)[36]
  • Grizzly Rage (2007; a grizzly bear)[1]
  • Into the Grizzly Maze (2014; a grizzly bear)[50]
  • Backcountry (2014, a black bear) [51]

Canines[edit]

  • Dogs (1976; domestic dogs turned into killers)[52]
  • The Pack (1977; feral dogs)[36]
  • Cujo (1983; a Saint Bernard infected with rabies)[53]
  • The Breed (2006; mutated feral dogs)[54]
  • Frozen (2010; gray wolves)[1]
  • The Pack (2015; feral dogs)[55]

Dolphins[edit]

  • Orca (1977; a killer whale)[3][36]

Felines[edit]

  • Black Zoo (1963; lions and tigers)[56]
  • Maneater (2007; a Bengal tiger)[1]
  • Burning Bright (2010, a tiger)[57]

Pigs[edit]

  • Pigs (1973)[58]
  • Razorback (1984; a huge wild boar)[59]
  • Pig Hunt (2008; a boar)[60]

Primates[edit]

  • Blood Monkey (2007)[61]
  • Monkey Shines (1988)[62]

Rats[edit]

  • Willard (1971)[63]
  • Ben (1972)[64]
  • Deadly Eyes (1982; a.k.a. The Rats)[65]
  • Graveyard Shift (1990)[66]
  • Willard (2003)[67]

Others[edit]

  • Night of the Lepus (1972; giant rabbits)[68]
  • Black Sheep (2006; genetically engineered killer sheep)[7]

Mollusks[edit]

Gastropods[edit]

  • Slugs (1988; abnormally large killer black slugs)[69]

Octopuses and Squids[edit]

  • Bride of the Monster (1955; a killer octopus)[70][71]
  • Tentacles (1977; a giant octopus)[36]
  • Octopus (2000, a giant octopus)[72][73][74]

Reptiles[edit]

Alligators and crocodiles[edit]

  • The Great Alligator River (1979; an alligator god)[75]
  • Alligator (1980; an abnormally large American alligator)[3]
    • Alligator II: The Mutation (1991; a mutant alligator)[1]
  • Dark Age (1986; a monstrous crocodile God called Numunwari)[76]
  • Killer Crocodile (1989, mutated large crocodile)[77]
  • Lake Placid (1999; an abnormally large saltwater crocodile)[78]
    • Lake Placid 2 (2007)[79]
    • Lake Placid 3 (2010)[80]
    • Lake Placid: The Final Chapter (2012)[81]
  • Crocodile (2000; an abnormally large Nile crocodile)[82]
  • Blood Surf (2001; a monstrous giant crocodile)[83]
  • Black Water (2007; a saltwater crocodile)[56]
  • Croc (2007; a saltwater crocodile)[1]
  • Primeval (2007; Gustave)[84]
  • Rogue (2007; a giant saltwater crocodile)[85]
  • Crawl (2019; several American alligators)[86]

Snakes[edit]

  • Rattlers (1976)[87]
  • Anaconda (1997)[88]
    • Anacondas: The Hunt for the Blood Orchid (2004)[89]
    • Anaconda 3: Offspring (2008)[90]
    • Anacondas: Trail of Blood (2009)[91]
  • King Cobra (1999)[92]
  • Silent Predators (1999; rattlesnakes)[1]
  • Snakes on a Plane (2006)[93]
  • Mega Snake (2007)[94]

Plants[edit]

  • Little Shop of Horrors (1960; mutant Venus flytrap)[95]
  • The Day of the Triffids (1962; man-eating plants)[20]
  • Attack of the Killer Tomatoes (1978; killer tomatoes)[20]
  • The Ruins (2008; vines)[96]

Worms[edit]

  • Attack of the Giant Leeches (1959, giant leeches)[97]
  • Squirm (1976, bloodworms and sandworms)[36]
  • Blood Beach (1982; a giant worm)[7]

Miscellaneous[edit]

  • Godzilla (1954; a giant irradiated Godzillasaurus)[98]
  • Frogs (1972; various species of animals)[99]
  • The Food of the Gods (1976; various species of animals)[100]
  • Day of the Animals (1977; various species of animals)[3][36]

paragraphs.text:
Natural horror is a subgenre of horror films that features natural forces,[1] typically in the form of animals or plants, that pose a threat to human characters.

Though killer animals in film have existed since the release of The Lost World in 1925,[2] two of the first motion pictures to garner mainstream success with a "nature run amok" premise were The Birds, directed by Alfred Hitchcock and released in 1963; and Jaws, directed by Steven Spielberg and released in 1975. Following Jaws, numerous horror films of a similar narrative were produced, including Grizzly (1976), Piranha (1978), and Alligator (1980).[3]

paragraphs.title: Arthropods
paragraphs.text: See also the section on insects.
